apiConnectorsPageDescription: $t(shared:project.name) creates an API client connector when you upload a valid OpenAPI 2.0 specification that describes the API you want to connect to.
createApiConnectorTip: Upload file or use URL to create API connector
deleteModalMessage: Are you sure you want to delete the "{{name}}" API client connector?
emptyStateInfo: There are no currently available API connectors. Click the button below to create one.
errorDeletingApiConnector: Unexpected server error deleting API client connector "{{connectorId}}".
errorSavingApiConnector: Unexpected server error saving the API client connector.
reviewValidationFallback: No connector details are currently available.

create.unsavedChangesTitle: Do you really want to cancel?
create.unsavedChangesMessage: You have not finished creating the API client connector. If you cancel now you will lose data you already entered. Do you still want to cancel?

selectMethod.dndInstructions: Drag and drop a file here, or click to select a file by using a file chooser dialog.
selectMethod.title: Upload OpenAPI Document
selectMethod.urlNote: * Note: After uploading this document, updates to it are not automatically obtained.

review.description: This description has not yet been actually defined, please send help.
review.title: Review Actions

security.description: $t(shared:project.name) reads the OpenAPI definition to determine the information needed to configure the connector to meet the APIâ€™s security requirements. Connections created from this connector always use the authentication type that you select here.
security.title: Specify Security
